name: The Label Maker Trivia Game | 'Seinfeld' - Season 6 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who does Jerry give his Superbowl tickets to?
questions.explanation:
Tim Whatley.

	In the beginning of the episode, Jerry is trying to get rid of his Superbowl tickets because he can't go.  Instead, he has to go to a wedding party for 'The Drake' because he has been written into it.  He tries to give the tickets to Kramer, but he's only interested in Canadian football.  George doesn't want them either because they're like a $1,500 bill.

questions.text: What is the name of the label maker that Jerry receives?
questions.explanation:
The Label-Baby Jr.

	As a gift, Tim Whatley gives Jerry the Label-Baby Jr. as a thank you gift for the Superbowl tickets.  This label maker turns out to be the same one that Elaine gave to Whatley as a gift.  Jerry and Elaine end up calling Whatley a re-gifter.

questions.text: What country does Kramer compare Jerry to in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Switzerland.

	Kramer and Newman have been playing "Risk" for six hours, and in order to prevent Newman from cheating, Kramer decides to place their board in Jerry's apartment.  After this, Elaine comes into the apartment and find the label maker.  She says that she gave it to Whatley because he let her get dental work done free of charge.

questions.text: What is the name of Bonnie's roommate?
questions.explanation:
Scott.

	When George visits Bonnie's apartment for the first time, he is ecstatic because he loves her velvet couch and hardwood floors.  George states that if it were possible, he would drape himself in velvet.  When he's introduced to Scott, he realizes that he looks identical to him.

questions.text: On what day was The Drake's wedding supposed to fall?
questions.explanation:
Sunday.

	The wedding was supposed to fall on Superbowl Sunday, and this is why Jerry was forced to give up his tickets.  At Monk's, Kramer informs Jerry that the wedding is off because 'The Drake' realized that the wedding was during the Superbowl, so he and his fiancé got into an argument and decided to put off the wedding.

questions.text: Who is given a ticket to the Superbowl?
questions.explanation:
Newman.

	While trying to get at the game of "Risk", Newman tells Jerry that he was offered one of Tim Whatley's Superbowl tickets.  Meanwhile, George tries to find out more about Bonnie and Scott because he's concerned about their roommate relationship.

questions.text: What does George buy after the fight with Bonnie?
questions.explanation:
A cactus.

	At Monk's, Jerry is angry because Newman is going to the Superbowl with his tickets and George has a cactus in order to smooth things out with Bonnie.  Elaine comes in and says that she's getting Tim Whatley's extra Superbowl ticket.  This means that Newman is no longer going.  Jerry and George assume that Elaine got the ticket because she wanted to go to the apartment.

questions.text: How does Newman get into Jerry's apartment while he's away?
options: He busted down the front door.
He couldn't get in.  Kramer was blocking him.
questions.explanation:
He used the fire escape.

	When Jerry returned from Monk's, he found Kramer watching Jerry's door through his peephole.  they hard CDs rattling inside and found Newman heading back up the fire escape in Jerry's bedroom.  Kramer decided to take Congo as a penalty to Newman.  Meanwhile, Bonnie asks Scott to move out.

questions.text: Does Jerry get his Superbowl ticket back?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	After things don't work out with Elaine, Tim Whatley gives Jerry back one of his tickets.  At this time, Kramer's car gets towed and he runs out of the building with the "Risk" board.  Meanwhile, George realizes that all of Bonnie's furniture was actually Scott's.  Since Scott moved out, he no longer had the velvet sofa.

questions.text: What country does Kramer call weak on the subway?
questions.explanation:
Ukraine.

	Kramer and Newman take their "Risk" game onto the subway and Newman is losing badly.  A man eavesdropping on their game says that he is from the Ukraine and smashes their board.  Meanwhile, Elaine waits outside of Whatley's building and the two start making out.  In the end, Whatley doesn't go to the Superbowl and he gives his ticket to Newman.  The label maker works horribly for Scott since the glue doesn't stick and all of his boxes are lost.  George has a horrible time and tries his 'switch' technique, but it goes horribly wrong as well.
